newsitem.title: USA: HarCor sets year-end drilling budget.
newsitem.headline: HarCor sets year-end drilling budget.

text.p: HarCor Energy Inc said Wednesday it has budgeted $5,650,000 for continued development of its leases in the San Joaquin Basin of California.
It said five additional Diatomite wells will be drilled in the fourth quarter and 15 deeper Shale interval wells will be drilled, recompleted or refraced.
The company also said it is continuing to evaluate performance of its initial horizontal well on the Ellis lease and may drill a second horizontal well later in the fourth quarter.
HarCor said a vertical step-out well drilled to the East of its horizontal well appears to have confirmed an eastern extension of the productive limits of the Ellis lease.
The company said it expects the California drilling activity should increase production during the second half of the fourth quarter and in the first quarter of 1997.
It said up to two rigs may be drilling in South Texas and one rig in the Permian Basin in November.
